donateLink_2.message: Did you know this is my full-time job?

donateLink_4.message: Donations = Features. Please consider a donation!

extDescription.message: A dockable sidebar for Chrome featuring vertical Tree Style Tabs, Tab Hibernation, and much more.

installInfoIntroduction.message: #Thanks for installing Sidewise, the first real sidebar for Chrome! //// To the left you should see the sidebar, currently showing a **Tree Style Tabs** view of your open tabs. The buttons along the top can be used to view other sidebar panes. //// Sidewise has many options which can be accessed via the sidebar's options button ![options](/images/nav/settings.png), but here's one setting that you may want to change right away:

installInfoPostIntroduction.message: #That's it for now! If you'd like to make your Sidewise experience even better, here are a couple other extensions that work well with Sidewise: //// * [Lazarus](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/loljledaigphbcpfhfmgopdkppkifgno): remembers what you typed into forms even if you close or hibernate a tab. // * [Open Selected Links](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/adnafknofhipknicoghcmjhnoejbidnp): Open multiple selected links on a page via the context menu. Designed to work with Sidewise. ////

notepad_hint.message: Just start typing. Text is auto-saved.

omniboxDefaultSuggestion.message: Enter text to search page titles and labels

option_allowAutoUnmaximize.message: Allow Sidewise to unmaximize the dock window

option_allowAutoUnmaximize_hint.message: !#If enabled, when you maximize the window that the sidebar is docked to, Sidewise will automatically resize the dock window so that both the dock window and its sidebar fit on the screen together.  //// Because this causes the dock window's 'unmaximize' button to become unavailable, Sidewise will restore the dock window to its original dimensions when you close the sidebar. //// Users of dual-monitor setups may prefer to disable this option, in which case Sidewise will just put the sidebar next to the maximized dock window (presumably onto an adjacent monitor).

option_animationEnabled_hint.message: Disabling animations can improve performance on slower machines.

option_autoCollapseLastSessionWindows.message: Automatically collapse Last Session windows on startup

option_autoCollapseLastSessionWindows_hi.message: #When enabled, 'Last Session' windows will be automatically collapsed in the Pages tree when you launch Chrome. //// When disabled, 'Last Session' windows will retain the same expanded/collapsed state they had during the last Chrome session. //// Regardless of this setting, whenever pages are restored within a 'Last Session' window, that window will be automatically expanded in the page tree.

option_autoSelectChildrenOnDrag_hint.message: #If enabled, when dragging a single row in a sidebar tree view, Sidewise will also select all its children rows (if any). This makes it easier to drag branches of the tree around. //// Regardless of this option, the following modifier keys can always be used when click-dragging a row: //// * Hold **Ctrl** to drag *only* the hovered row. // * Hold **Shift** to drag the selected rows along with all their children rows.

option_browserActionButtonBehavior.message: When browser toolbar button is clicked

option_browserActionButtonBehavior_hint.message: #Sidebar puts a ![button](/images/sidewise_icon_16.png) button on the browser's toolbar to the right of the address bar. You can control what happens when you click it: //// * *dock sidebar to window*: dock the sidebar to the current window, first opening the sidebar if it isn't already open. // * *toggle sidebar on/off*: just open or close the sidebar. //// When *dock sidebar to window* is selected, you can use the sidebar's own close button to close it.

option_dockState.message: Dock sidebar to this side of the window

option_focusSidebarOnHover.message: Focus the sidebar on mouse hover

option_focusSidebarOnHover_hint.message: #If enabled, Sidewise will automatically focus the sidebar when the mouse hovers over it. This may be especially helpful for Mac OSX users.

option_keepSidebarOnTop.message: Keep sidebar visible next to dock window

option_keepSidebarOnTop_hint.message: !#If enabled, when switching to Chrome from another app, Sidewise will bring the sidebar to the front, so other windows don't obscure or hide it. //// Unfortunately, due to [a limitation of Chrome](http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=129387), this messes with the OS's own window-ordering. For example, on Windows, you'll have to Alt-Tab twice to get back to your last non-Chrome window when this option is enabled.

option_loggingEnabled_hint.message: #For development or bug feedback only. //// Outputs verbose logging information to Javascript console of background, sidebar, and options pages, and prefixes rows in the pages sidebar with their IDs. //// Use the 'Send diagnostic report' button below to send collected diagnostic logging data to the author.

option_multiSelectActionConfirmThreshold.message: Confirm actions that would affect at least

#Sidewise will display a confirmation box before performing certain destructive actions, such as 'Close branch', when at least this many rows would be affected. //// Set this to 1 to be prompted as often as possible. //// Set this 0 to never be prompted.

option_pages_clickOnHoverDelay.message: Focus page rows on mouse hover

option_pages_clickOnHoverDelayMs.message: Wait this long before focusing on hover

option_pages_clickOnHoverDelay_hint.message: #If enabled, hovering the mouse over a page row in the page tree will focus it after the delay specified below. //// Focus-on-hover will not happen when you have multiple rows currently selected, when the context menu is open, or when the Shift or Ctrl keys are being held down.

option_pages_clickOnMouseWheel.message: Switch pages in sidebar with scroll wheel

option_pages_clickOnMouseWheel_hint.message: #When enabled, spinning the mouse's scroll wheel while hovering the sidebar will switch pages. //// Even when this option is enabled, normal sidebar scrolling can still be performed by spinning the wheel over the right 15% of the sidebar. //// In addition, the following key+wheel combinations always work regardless of this setting: //// **Shift+wheel:** switch pages when hovering sidebar // **Alt+wheel:** scroll sidebar when hovered

option_pages_createNewTabUrl.message: Creating a new tab from the sidebar opens

option_pages_createNewTabUrl_hint.message: #When clicking the ![new tab button](/images/create_tab.png) **Create new tab** button on a window row, or double-clicking in the empty space below the page tree, Sidewise will open a new tab. //// You can specify what page appears in the newly created tab: //// * **New Tab page**: opens Chrome's New Tab page. // * **your homepage:** opens your default homepage as specified in Chrome's settings. // * **google.com:** opens the google.com homepage. // * **blank tab**: opens a blank tab.

option_pages_showMediaPlayTime.message: Show current playback time on video pages

option_pages_showMediaPlayTime_hint.message: #When enabled, the current time of playing videos will be shown next to the video page's row title in [m:ss] format. //// Currently, many (but not all) Youtube, Vimeo, Jwplayer, and HTML5 video players are supported.

option_pages_trimPageTitlePrefixes.message: Trim similar prefixes from nearby page titles

option_pages_trimPageTitlePrefixes_hint.message: #Shortens a page row's title when a parent or adjacent page title starts with the same prefix. //// For example, if you have a parent page with title 'Random Blog - Homepage' and a child page with title 'Random Blog - Some article', the child page title would be shortened to just 'Some article'. //// Sidewise also takes title punctuation into account when deciding what to trim.

option_rememberOpenPagesBetweenSessions.message: Tree remembers open tabs between browser sessions

option_rememberOpenPagesBetweenSessions_.message: #When enabled, each time you restart Chrome, Sidewise will show any tabs you previously had open under a hibernated 'Last Session' row at the top of the Pages tree. From there you can selectively wake any or all of your previously open tabs. //// Disabling this option will prevent any 'Last Session' rows from showing. You can still access previous session activity via the **Recently closed** sidebar pane. //// **Pro tip:** If you have Chrome's 'Continue where I left off' option set (found in [Chrome's settings](chrome://settings)), Chrome has to reopen all your previously open tabs every time it starts up. By enabling this Sidewise option and switching the aforementioned Chrome option to 'Open the New Tab page' instead, Sidewise will retain your previous browsing session state for you, and Chrome won't have to reopen all your previously open tabs every startup. //// You can click a hibernated 'Last Session' row to automatically wake all previously open tabs in it.

option_reportUsageStatistics_hint.message: #Like many websites and other Chrome extensions, Sidewise uses Google Analytics to track usage levels of different parts of the extension. This tracking is [anonymized](https://developers.google.com/analytics/devguides/collection/gajs/methods/gaJSApi_gat#_gat._anonymizeIp) and no personal information is collected. //// If you'd rather not have Sidewise use Google Analytics tracking you can disable this option. //// To opt-out of all Google Analytics tracking browser-wide, install Google's [opt-out extension](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/fllaojicojecljbmefodhfapmkghcbnh/details).

option_showWhatsNewPane.message: Show the What's New sidebar pane whenever Sidewise is updated

option_sidebarTargetWidth_hint.message: #You can drag the edges of the sidebar to adjust its width, but if you prefer you can specify an exact value here. //// Close and reopen the sidebar for this setting to take effect.

option_smartFocusOnClose.message: Use smart focus logic when closing tabs

option_smartFocusOnClose_hint.message: #When enabled and the sidebar is open, Sidewise will use its own tree-oriented logic to decide which tab to focus next after a tab is closed. //// Note that this can sometimes cause a quick visual jump between two tabs after closing a tab, due to [a limitation of Chrome](http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=133503). //// Technical details: after a tab is closed, smart focus chooses the next tab to be focused in this priority order: //// * children tabs // * next sibling tab // * previous sibling tab // * parent tab // * next tab in tree // * previous tab in tree //// The options below can be used to further modify this order. //// If this option is disabled, Sidewise will always let Chrome decide which tab to focus next.

option_smartFocusPrefersCousins.message: Smart focus prefers next cousin before parent

option_smartFocusPrefersCousins_hint.message: #When this option is enabled, before focusing a parent or preceding tab, smart focus will try to skip down to the *next cousin* tab of the closing tab: that is, the next tab in the tree that is at the same *tree depth* as the closing tab. //// When disabled, smart focus will not attempt to focus the next cousin tab.

option_smartFocusPrefersParent.message: Smart focus prefers parent tab before next tab in tree

option_smartFocusPrefersParent_hint.message: #When this option is enabled, after closing the last remaining child tab of some parent tab, smart focus will focus that parent tab. //// When disabled, instead of focusing that parent tab, smart focus will prefer to focus the *next* tab in the tree first. This is more suited to a 'clean up parents later' workflow. //// Even when this option is disabled, after closing the last child of some parent tab, if that parent tab was the one focused *just prior to* the child tab, then that parent tab will be focused.

option_submitBugReportButton_hint.message: To send diagnostic reports, first check the "Enable diagnostics" checkbox option above. Reproduce the problem you were having, then click this button to send a report.

option_useAdvancedTreeFiltering_hint.message: #Normally, when searching from a sidebar tree's search box, Sidewise will only match rows that contain your search term(s). //// With this option enabled, a row will also match if it contains the same *characters* you entered, in the same *order*, anywhere across the row. //// For example, with this option enabled, a row with the title of 'Foobar' would match if you searched for 'fbar', because all your search characters were found in that order. //// With this option disabled, 'fbar' would not match the row, since the substring 'fbar' does not appear in 'Foobar'. You would need to use a search like 'foo', or a multi-term search like 'f bar'. //// **Tip:** You can also type "sw sometext" into Chrome's address bar to find pages in Sidewise.

option_wakeHibernatedPagesOnClick.message: Wake hibernated page rows on click

option_wakeHibernatedPagesOnClick_hint.message: #When enabled, clicking a hibernated page row in the Pages tree will wake it. //// When disabled, you can still wake hibernated page rows using the hibernate/wake button at the right end of the row, or from the right click menu.

optionsDefaultStatus.message: Hello! This is Sidewise's options page. Modify your options below.

optionsInfoMonitorDetection.message: #Whenever you change your monitor configuration, *restart Chrome*, then come here and click 'Detect all monitors now' below. //// This should be done whenever you add or remove monitors, change monitor resolutions, reposition monitors in your OS settings, or change the location/size of your system taskbars.

optionsInfoMonitorsOnYourSystem.message: #Sidewise currently believes you have **$1** $2 connected to your system.

optionsInfoPanePicker.message: Toggle sidebar panes below, or reorder them using drag and drop.

optionsSaveNotNeeded.message: Note: Settings are automatically saved as you change them.

optionsShowPanePicker.message: Toggle and reorder available sidebar panes

pages_omniboxTip.message: Tip: You can type "sw sometext" into Chrome's address bar to find pages in Sidewise.

prompt_confirmResetOptions.message: Are you sure you want to reset all options to the defaults?

prompt_detectMonitors.message: Sidewise will detect your monitor(s) now.

prompt_detectMonitors_beta.message: A word of warning to Mac/Linux users: // Mac/Linux support in Sidewise is currently rather flaky. Due to bugs in Chrome, Sidewise has a hard time working well on these OS's (especially Linux). // These issues will be addressed in a future release or when the Chrome team fixes the underlying bugs. // For best results on these OS's it is currently recommended that you set the 'dock sidebar to this side of the window' option to 'undocked' in Sidewise's options page.

prompt_filterActiveText.message: Matches shown, click here to reset

prompt_filterPlaceholderText.message: Type to search titles and URLs

prompt_hibernatingLastTab.message: You just hibernated the last open tab in Chrome. // Since this would normally cause Chrome to automatically exit, Sidewise has created a New Tab tab to prevent it from doing so.

prompt_setLabel.message: Enter the new label/title, or clear box for none:
